data.title: Enterprise Community Partners
data.meta_description: Patrick Boyle, Senior Director, Programs for Enterprise Community Partners in the New York market.
data.text:
Patrick Boyle is senior director for the New York market office, where he leads policy and communications efforts. He is responsible for advancing Enterprise New York’s policy and legislative priorities at the state and local level, serving as a liaison to elected officials and government agencies, and representing the office in a number of advocacy coalitions. He also oversees both internal and external communications functions for the New York market office, including media, newsletters, social media and thought leadership.

Prior to joining Enterprise, Patrick was assistant vice president for public policy at Volunteers of America-Greater New York, a large social services provider and supportive housing developer, and prior to that was director of policy for NYSAFAH, the state’s New York State’s affordable housing trade organization. He began his career in the office of then-Assemblymember Hakeem Jeffries, working for the member in his capacity as a state legislator and later as a member of congress.
